required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Epidural Anesthesia/Analgesia and Outcome of Patients After Lung Cancer Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Epidural Anesthesia/Analgesia on Recurrence and Metastasis in Patients After Lung Cancer Surgery: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Some studies suggest that regional anesthesia/analgesia may decrease the rate of recurrence/metastasis in patients after cancer surgery. However, evidences from prospective studies are still lacking. The purpose of this randomized controlled trial is to investigate the effect of epidural anesthesia/analgesia on the rate of recurrence/metastasis in patients undergoing lung cancer surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
Lung cancer is rapidly increasing and is a primary cause of cancer deaths. Surgical resection is the first line of treatment for lung cancer. However, it is unavoidable that some tumor cells will be disseminated into the blood or the lymphatic systems during surgery. The outcome depends on the balance between tumor-promoting factors and immune function of the body during the perioperative period.
Studies showed that stress response induced by surgery inhibits the cell-mediated immunity. In addition, anesthesia management during perioperative period can all affect the immune function of patients; for example, volatile anesthetics and opioids might aggravate the immunosuppression and potentially worsen long-term outcome, whereas regional anesthesia might attenuate the immunosuppression and exert protective effects. However, existing evidences are insufficient to draw conclusion in this topic.
The investigators hypothesize that regional anesthesia might improve long-term outcome in patients after lung cancer surgery, possibly by preserving postoperative immune function. The purpose of this randomized controlled trial is to investigate the effect of epidural anesthesia/analgesia on the rate of recurrence/metastasis in patients undergoing lung cancer surgery.

primary_outcome.description: Recurrence-free survival within 2 years after surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 3 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed with numeric rating score where 0 = no pain and 10 = the most severe pain

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 30 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Postoperative complications that occurred within 30 days after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of stay in hospital after surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From end of surgery to 30 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Length of stay in hospital after surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 30 days after surgery
At the end 1 year after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor-free survival rate at 1 year after surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of 2 years after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor-free survival rate at 2 years after surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of 1 year after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Survival rate at 1 year after surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of 2 years after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Survival rate at 2 years after surgery

other_outcome.measure: Number of CD8+ and FOXP3+ T cells per mm2 tumor area
other_outcome.time_frame: After resection of lung adenocarcinoma specimens
other_outcome.description: Immunohistochemical staining of CD8 and FOXP3 molecules in excised lung adenocarcinoma specimens. Performed in part of enrolled patients.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of NK-cells and T-cell subgroups in peripheral blood
other_outcome.time_frame: Peripheral blood samples collected before induction, at the end of surgery and at 24 hours after surgery
other_outcome.description: Measured by flow cytometry. Performed in part of enrolled patients.

other_outcome.measure: The chronic pain at 3 month and 6 month after surgery
other_outcome.time_frame: At 3 months and 6 months after surgery
other_outcome.description: Measured by Brief Pain Inventory (BPI), neuropathic pain screening questionnaire (ID pain), and McGill Pain Questionnair (MPQ)

arm_group.description: Combined epidural-general anesthesia (combined Epi-GA) will be performed during surgery and patient-controlled epidural analgesia (PCEA) will be provided after surgery
General anesthesia (GA) will be performed during surgery and patient-controlled intravenous analgesia (PCIA) will be provided after surgery

intervention.description: Thoracic epidural catheterization will be performed according the surgical incision site. General anesthesia will be induced and maintained as in the control group, combined with epidural anesthesia which will be maintained with 0.5% ropivacaine during surgery.
Patient-controlled epidural analgesia (0.12% ropivacaine and 0.5 ug/ml sufentanil) will be provided after surgery.

General anesthesia will be induced with midazolam, propofol, sufentanil and rocuronium. Anesthesia will be maintained with intravenous (propofol), inhalational (sevoflurane), or combined intravenous-inhalational anesthetics. Opioids and muscle relaxants will be administered when considered necessary.
Patient-controlled intravenous analgesia (0.5 mg/ml morphine) will be provided after surgery.
